title: Drones Strike Moscow Civilian Areas, a First in Russia-Ukraine War
description: At least eight drones were intercepted, the Kremlin said, but the foray raised questions about Russian air defenses.

title: North Korean Rocket Triggers ‘False-Alarm’ Evacuation Order in South Korea
description: The North has said its space rocket will carry a spy satellite, the country’s first, that will allow it to watch its enemies in the region more closely.

title: Debt Deal Includes a Green Light for a Contentious Pipeline
description: Climate activists are livid over a provision in the debt limit agreement that orders federal agencies to issue permits for the Mountain Valley Pipeline — and says courts can’t review them.

title: Fluorescein Turned Venice Grand Canal Green, Officials Say
description: A chemical used in underwater construction and medical procedures was used to dye parts of the channel bright green, but the authorities still don’t know how it got there.

title: Wildfire Near Halifax, Nova Scotia, Leads to Evacuation of More Than 16,000
description: Wildfires in Nova Scotia have heightened the sense of unease as blazes also burn in the west of the country.

title: What is Behind the Rising Tensions Between Kosovo and Serbia?
description: Clashes in northern Kosovo that injured dozens of ethnic Serbs and NATO soldiers are the latest flare up in a long-running standoff between Kosovo and Serbia.

title: A Plan to Avert a Vast Oil Spill Off Yemen Moves Ahead
description: A decaying tanker holds about four times the amount of oil leaked in the 1989 Exxon Valdez spill. Experts have warned that it is an ecological time bomb that could explode or disintegrate at any moment.

title: How Harmful Are Gas Stove Pollutants, Really?
description: Scientists are lugging sophisticated sensors into homes in 10 cities to measure and track the pollution from gas stoves as it drifts from room to room.

title: The Impact of the Moscow Drone Strike Is Psychological, Russian Military Commentators Say
description: The Kremlin says the Defense Ministry responded well to the attack, but critics argue that the assault shows a lack of leadership from a government that promised only a “special military operation” in Ukraine.

title: Erdogan Pushed to Victory in Turkey by Conservative Women
description: In winning another term as Turkey’s president, Recep Tayyip Erdogan was propelled to victory in part by the fervent support of an often underappreciated constituency — conservative religious women.

title: Live Updates: Drone Strikes Damage Buildings in Moscow as Kyiv Is Hit Again
description: The drone attack in Moscow was a potent sign that the war is increasingly reaching the heart of Russia. It came as an aerial assault on Ukraine’s capital left at least one person dead.

title: The Impact of the Moscow Drone Strike Is Psychological, Russian Military Commentators Say
description: The Kremlin says the Defense Ministry responded well to the attack, but critics argue the assault shows a lack of leadership from a government that promised only a “special military operation” in Ukraine.

title: Summer Heat
description: Why the next few months may be hotter than normal.

title: Moscow Drone Attack: What We Know
description: Russia’s Defense Ministry said that at least eight drones had targeted Moscow and the surrounding region.

title: A Journey Across London on the Elizabeth Line
description: The new rail line lets travelers leave the city’s tourist-clogged core and embark on fast, inexpensive journeys to fascinating outer-London destinations, from a bustling market town to a hub of South Asian culture.

title: Germany’s Tenuous Coalition Government Shows Strain
description: Tensions in the three-party government have built for months. But the latest sniping is unusually fierce, raising fresh questions of dysfunction.

title: Alberta’s Conservatives Retain Power Behind Hard-Right Leader
description: But the United Conservative Party will hold substantially fewer seats in the legislature, in an apparent rebuff of the politics of its outspoken leader.

title: A British Reporter Had a Big #MeToo Scoop. Her Editor Killed It.
description: Seven women say that a star columnist groped them or made unwanted sexual advances. But Britain’s news media has a complicated relationship with outing its own.

title: At Guantánamo’s Court Like No Other, Progress Is Frustrated by State Secrets
description: The U.S. government is still sorting out what’s secret in an Indonesian bombing case more than two decades after the attack.

title: Would Large Language Models Be Better If They Weren’t So Large?
description: Teaching fewer words to large language models might help them sound more human.

title: Would Large Language Models Be Better If They Weren’t So Large?
description: Teaching fewer words to large language models might help them sound more human.

title: Your Tuesday Briefing
description: Assaults on Kyiv.

title: Russia Targets Kyiv With Third Wave of Strikes in 24 Hours, Killing One
description: The attack followed a rare daytime assault on Monday. Russia has stepped up attacks on the capital this month as Ukraine prepares for a counteroffensive.

title: Guyanese Teenager Is Charged With 19 Counts of Murder in School Dorm Fire
description: Investigators have accused the 15-year-old student of starting the blaze in anger after her mobile phone was confiscated.

title: Russian Guards Beat and Tortured Kherson Prisoners, Leading to Deaths
description: Ukraine has charged four members of Russia’s National Guard with war crimes in Kherson. The four acted with such impunity, the authorities say, they did not mask their identities.
